sentence.text: Simultaneous determination of rosuvastatin and atorvastatin in human serum using RP-HPLC/UV detection: method development, validation and optimization of various experimental parameters.

A novel, precise, accurate and rapid isocratic reversed-phase high performance liquid chromatographic/ultraviolet (RP-HPLC/UV) method was developed, optimized and validated for simultaneous determination of rosuvastatin and atorvastatin in human serum using naproxen sodium as an internal standard
Effect of different experimental parameters and various particulate columns on the analysis of these analytes was evaluated
The method showed adequate separation for rosuvastatin and atorvastatin and best resolution was achieved with Brownlee analytical C18 column (150×4
6 mm, 5 μm) using methanol-water (68:32, v/v; pH adjusted to 3
0 with trifluoroacetic acid) as a mobile phase at a flow rate of 1
The calibration curves were linear over the concentration ranges of 2
The lower limit of detection (LLOD) and lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) for rosuvastatin were 0
All the analytes were separated in less than 7

The proposed method could be applied for routine laboratory analysis of rosuvastatin and atorvastatin in human serum samples, pharmaceutical formulations, drug-drug interaction studies and pharmacokinetics studies
